verses.verse: Send<WH7971> the lambs<WH3733> for the ruler<WH4910> of the land<WH776> from Selah<WH5554> to the wilderness,<WH4057> to the mountain<WH2022> of the daughter<WH1323> of Zion.<WH6726>
For it will be that as wandering<WH5074> birds,<WH5775> as a scattered<WH7971> nest,<WH7064> so will the daughters<WH1323> of Moab<WH4124> be at the fords<WH4569> of the Arnon.<WH769>

Give counsel!<WH6098> Execute<WH6213> justice!<WH6415> Make<WH7896> your shade<WH6738> like the night<WH3915> in the midst<WH8432> of the noonday!<WH6672> Hide<WH5641> the outcasts!<WH5080> Don't<WH5074> betray the fugitive!

Let my outcasts<WH5080> dwell<WH1481> with you!<WH4124> As for Moab, be<WH1933> a hiding<WH5643> place for him from the face<WH6440> of the destroyer.<WH7703> For the extortioner<WH4160> is brought to nothing.<WH656> Destruction<WH7701> ceases.<WH3615> The oppressors<WH7429> are consumed<WH8552> out of the land.<WH776>

A throne<WH3678> will be established<WH3559> in loving kindness.<WH2617> One will sit<WH3427> on it in truth,<WH571> in the tent<WH168> of David,<WH1732> judging,<WH8199> seeking<WH1875> justice,<WH4941> and swift<WH4106> to do righteousness.<WH6664>

We have heard<WH8085> of the pride<WH1347> of Moab,<WH4124> that he is very<WH3966> proud;<WH1341> even of his arrogance,<WH1347> his pride,<WH1347> and his wrath.<WH5678> His boastings are nothing.<WH907>
Therefore Moab<WH4124> will wail<WH3213> for Moab.<WH4124> Everyone will wail.<WH3213> You will mourn<WH1897> for the raisin cakes<WH808> of Kir Hareseth,<WH7025> utterly stricken.<WH5218>

For the fields<WH7709> of Heshbon<WH2809> languish<WH535> with the vine<WH1612> of Sibmah.<WH7643> The lords<WH1167> of the nations<WH1471> have broken down<WH1986> its choice branches,<WH8291> which reached<WH5060> even to Jazer,<WH3270> which wandered<WH8582> into the wilderness.<WH4057> Its shoots<WH7976> were spread abroad.<WH5203> They passed over<WH5674> the sea.<WH3220>

Therefore I will weep<WH1058> with the weeping<WH1065> of Jazer<WH3270> for the vine<WH1612> of Sibmah.<WH7643> I will water<WH7301> you with my tears,<WH1832> Heshbon,<WH2809> and Elealeh:<WH500> for on your summer fruits<WH7019> and on your harvest<WH7105> the battle shout<WH1959> has fallen.<WH5307>

Gladness<WH8057> is taken away,<WH622> and joy<WH1524> out of the fruitful field;<WH3759> and in the vineyards<WH3754> there will be no singing,<WH7442> neither joyful noise.<WH7321> Nobody will tread<WH1869> out<WH1869> wine<WH3196> in the presses.<WH3342> I have made the shouting<WH1959> stop.<WH7673>
Therefore my heart<WH4578> sounds<WH1993> like a harp<WH3658> for Moab,<WH4124> and my inward parts<WH7130> for Kir Heres.<WH7025>

It will happen that when Moab<WH4124> presents<WH7200> himself,<WH3811> when he wearies himself on the high place,<WH1116> and comes<WH935> to his sanctuary<WH4720> to pray,<WH6419> that he will not prevail.<WH3201>
This is the word<WH1697> that Yahweh<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> concerning Moab<WH4124> in time past.<WH227>

But now Yahweh<WH3068> has spoken,<WH1696> saying,<WH559> "Within three<WH7969> years,<WH8141> as a worker bound by contract<WH7916> would count<WH8141> them,<WH3519> the glory of Moab<WH4124> shall be brought into contempt,<WH7034> with all his great<WH7227> multitude;<WH1995> and the remnant<WH7605> will be very<WH4592> small<WH4213> and feeble.<WH3808>"
